Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add administrator portal for vulnerability metadata" (#7683) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
This Admin page should allow the following:
- adding a vulnerability
- removing a vulnerability
- adding a package to a vulnerability
- removing a package from a vulnerability

Note that these behaviors should be done in such a way that GitHubVulnerabilities2Db does not overwrite them.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Implement job to fetch vulnerabilities from GitHub" (#7648) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "Darken social buttons for accessibility" (#8220) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
‚ö† This change is blocked until we receive approval from CELA.

For WCAG 2.1, web components must have a 3:1 contrast ratio. This darkens the social media icons on the display package page.

Before:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94204286-cfd9af00-fe75-11ea-87a9-f1e37d5a73af.png)

After:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94204293-d405cc80-fe75-11ea-88dc-908b5a586fb0.png)

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8185

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Darken buttons for accessibility" (#8219) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
For WCAG 2.1, web components must have a 3:1 contrast ratio.

## Darken nuget.org's "default" button

This darkens the "default" button, often used to cancel forms.

<details>
<summary>List of affected buttons...</summary>

* Cancel create API key form
* Packages
  * Cancel package upload on verify page
  * Accept new package owner
  * Reject new package owner
* Account
  * Sign in using external account not linked to a nuget.org account
  * Register using external account
  * Sign in using external account
  * Link nuget.org account to external account (prompted after login)
  * Link nuget.org account to different external account on profile page
  * Cancel "Why did you choose not to enable 2FA?" survey
  * Enable 2FA on profile page
  * Transform to organization
  * Cancel transform to organization form
  * Cancel pending email change
  * Cancel email change form
  * Cancel change notifications form
  * Cancel change password form
  * Cancel link to external account form
  * Cancel delete account
* Organizations
  * Cancel creating organization
  * Cancel deleting organization on organization profile page
  * Cancel deleting organization on confirm deletion page
  * Accept organization membership
  * Reject organization membership
* Admin
  * Cancel editing a flight
</details>

<details>
<summary>Before...</summary>

Light n' almost invisible:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94200657-9bfb8b00-fe6f-11ea-8eeb-f805b4ba0da9.png)

</details>

<details>
<summary>After...</summary>

Very dark. Very edgy:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94200671-a158d580-fe6f-11ea-9bfb-8a772ccaebec.png)

</details>

## Darken nuget.org's "warning" button

This affects both the "search" button and the "copy installation instructions" button.

<details>
<summary>Before...</summary>

Very bright. Very radiant:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94200502-5d65d080-fe6f-11ea-9860-c4ffe1a83351.png)
</details>

<details>
<summary>After...</summary>

Very dark. Very edgy:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94200527-69ea2900-fe6f-11ea-8777-6fa8402f9be3.png)

</details>

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8195
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8192

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Test packages are visible on search results when filtering by last uploaded" (#8172) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug
See twitter thread: https://twitter.com/buhakmeh/status/1299115494973341696

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run Functional tests / E2E tests
2. Sort search results by "Recently updated"

### Expected behavior
User packages only are shown

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16807822/91502274-839e4d80-e87c-11ea-9953-8a7d873d0a2f.png)

### Additional context
We need to unlist/delete those packages after test completion

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Clean-up the MSBuildProjectFrameworkUtility.GetProjectFrameworkStrings - Use the version with NuGetFramework instead." (#9878) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "[CPVM-Perf] Do not write all the CPVM info in the target libraries when the target is a project ref. " (#10001) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Currently if project1 refrences project2 and they are CPVM enabled, the project1's assets file will include all the CPVM versions as part of the project2 dependencies. 

It should not include them.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Implement --offline support for dotnet list package" (#8834) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Dotnet Pack mistakenly uses alias for WPF Library projects" (#10020) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
When packing a project with a target platform, when the target platform version is not included in the .csproj (but a platform is), the lib files are pulled in using the "alias".

## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): All of the above

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate): 5.0.100-rc.1.20454.5

VS version (if appropriate): 16.8.4-pre.4.0

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): win10

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: no

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. mkdir nuget-repro && cd nuget-repro && dotnet new wpflib
2. dotnet pack
3. look in the .nupkg lib directory

## Result

We get a facefull of warnings:

```
‚ùØ dotnet pack
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.8.0-preview-20451-02+51a1071f8 for .NET
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

  Determining projects to restore...
  All projects are up-to-date for restore.
  You are using a preview version of .NET. See: https://aka.ms/dotnet-core-preview
  bar -> C:\Users\kmarchan\src\bar\bin\Debug\net5.0-windows\bar.dll
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20454.5\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(198,5): warning NU5128: Some target frameworks declared in the dependencies group of the nuspec and the lib/ref folder do not have exact matches in the other location. Consult the list of actions below: [C:\Users\kmarchan\src\bar\bar.csproj]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20454.5\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(198,5): warning NU5128: - Add a dependency group for net5.0-windows to the nuspec [C:\Users\kmarchan\src\bar\bar.csproj]
C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100-rc.1.20454.5\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(198,5): warning NU5128: - Add lib or ref assemblies for the net5.0-windows7.0 target framework [C:\Users\kmarchan\src\bar\bar.csproj]
  Successfully created package 'C:\Users\kmarchan\src\bar\bin\Debug\bar.1.0.0.nupkg'.
```

...and it's using `net5.0-windows` instead of `net5.0-windows7.0`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PM UI not updating correctly after repeated upgrade and downgrade operation" (#9952) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
I noticed PM UI doesn't update correctly if I keep upgrading or downgrading projects. It doesn't happen all the time, but if you try long enough then you'll notice it. I included gif animation for one case. ![PMUI_DelayToUpdate2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8766776/91482512-08786f80-e85b-11ea-9ab1-0888ac5e54a5.gif)
It looks it's regression for PM UI experience. All dependency files on `obj` folder was updated with updated version( and csproj too), but PMUI doesn't. But if I close and reopen PMUI then it shows correct updated version.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Please note it doesn't happen all the time you need to play sometime.

### Sample Project

I used my personal test project for this gif animation. 
https://github.com/erdembayar/MainApplicationTestSolution

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Updates Tab Checkbox selection is lost when package is clipped by viewport" (#10065) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Not a Regression

## Details
WPF automatically scrolls items lists when an item is clicked, but not fully in view. This can make interacting with the PMUI unnecessarily difficult.
From VSFeedback: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1214662

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem
_Three packages in the PMUI, where the third package is clipped slightly_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49205731/94184204-8e470500-fe71-11ea-9866-d5d9807a8905.png)

1. Open PMUI on a solution/project with at least 4 available Updates.

2. Resize the window and/or scroll, as necessary, so that the 3rd package (For example) is clipped by the bottom of the window pane.

3. Click the Checkbox on the 3rd package, as if to select it for an Update.

4. Observe that the checkbox does not select, but instead, the packages list scrolls down so the 3rd package is fully in focus.

5. Now, clicking the Checkbox works as expected.



## Other suggested things
Found some likely relevant examples on SO: 
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39110872/selecting-a-partially-displayed-wpf-checkbox
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12928356/annoying-auto-scroll-of-partially-displayed-items-in-wpf-listview

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dotnet on Linux incorrectly detects revoked certificates on signed packages." (#9941) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The package https://www.nuget.org/packages/Rido.CoreAppLauncher/0.0.1-Beta1 is signed with author and repo certificates.

NuGet.exe  5.4.0.6315 reports the package as valid
```
Successfully verified package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1'.
```
<details>
Verifying Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1
C:\Users\rido\Downloads\rido.coreapplauncher.0.0.1-beta1.nupkg

Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
Timestamp: 11/7/2018 8:31:32 PM

Verifying author primary signature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Timestamp Responder, O=DigiCert, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 400191475C98891DEBA104AF47091B5EB6D4CBCB
  SHA256 hash: FC834D5BFFDE31DBA5B79BF95F573F7953BCBF9156E8525163E828EB92EA8A93
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Timestamping CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 1/3/2017 4:00:00 PM to 1/17/2028 4:00:00 PM

Verifying the author primary signature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=Ricardo Minguez, O=Ricardo Minguez, L=Redmond, S=Washington, C=US

  SHA256 hash: 518F74AE79E44C7451FB5013E63D46BFF967A11AA13CD8F4586C57059AE900C9
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Code Signing CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 7/11/2018 5:00:00 PM to 10/11/2019 5:00:00 AM

Timestamp: 11/7/2018 8:36:43 PM

Verifying repository countersignature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=Symantec SHA256 TimeStamping Signer - G2, OU=Symantec Trust Network, O=Symantec Corporation, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 625AEC3AE4EDA1D169C4EE909E85B3BBC61076D3
  SHA256 hash: CF7AC17AD047ECD5FDC36822031B12D4EF078B6F2B4C5E6BA41F8FF2CF4BAD67
  Issued by: CN=Symantec SHA256 TimeStamping CA, OU=Symantec Trust Network, O=Symantec Corporation, C=US
  Valid from: 1/1/2017 4:00:00 PM to 4/1/2028 4:59:59 PM

Signature type: Repository
nuget-v3-service-index-url: https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
nuget-package-owners: ridomin
Verifying the repository countersignature with certificate:
  Subject Name: CN=NuGet.org Repository by Microsoft, O=NuGet.org Repository by Microsoft, L=Redmond, S=Washington, C=US
  SHA1 hash: 8FB6D7FCF7AD49EB774446EFE778B33365BB7BFB
  SHA256 hash: 0E5F38F57DC1BCC806D8494F4F90FBCEDD988B46760709CBEEC6F4219AA6157D
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Code Signing CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 4/9/2018 5:00:00 PM to 4/14/2021 5:00:00 AM


Successfully verified package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher.0.0.1-Beta1'.
</details>

When trying to install the same package in Ubuntu 20 (WSL2) with `dotnet 5.0.100-preview.8.20417.9` I got the following error

```
error: Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature found a chain building issue: Revoked: certificate revoked
```

error: Package 'Rido.CoreAppLauncher 0.0.1-Beta1' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The author primary signature found a chain building issue: Revoked: certificate revoked

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Use [AppliesToProject] on IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider implementations" (#10044) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Visual Studio has recently [added `[AppliesToProject]`](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_git/VS/pullrequest/271500) support for `IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider` providers, which can be used to prevent unneeded dlls. NuGet should use this for all their implementations to avoid unneeded loads of this dll in projects/solutions where it is not applicable, for example:

``` C#
    [Export(typeof(IAttachedCollectionSourceProvider))]
    [Name(nameof(PackageReferenceAttachedCollectionSourceProvider))]
    [Order(Before = HierarchyItemsProviderNames.Contains)]
    [AppliesToProject("DependenciesTree")] 
```

This is required to fix this [performance gate that was broken](https://dev.azure.com/devdiv/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1136214) that got an exception for 16.7.

**Note:** Similar to UI contexts for commands/packages this only controls whether your implementation is loaded for a given solution. You will still be called back for projects that do not contain these capabilities and you will need to continue to handle this.
